description: Primes p for which the period of reciprocal = (p-1)/10.
comments: Cyclic numbers of the tenth degree (or tenth order): the reciprocals of these numbers belong to one of ten different cycles. Each cycle has the (number minus 1)/10 digits.
links: Index entries for sequences related to decimal expansion of 1/n
mathematica: f[n_Integer] := Block[{ds = Divisors[n - 1]}, (n - 1)/Take[ ds, Position[ PowerMod[ 10, ds, n], 1] [[1, 1]]] [[ -1]]]; Select[ Prime[ Range[4, 3000]], f[ # ] == 10 &]
author: _Robert G. Wilson v_, Sep 15 2004
extensions: Entry revised by _N. J. A. Sloane_, Apr 30 2007
